['The angels are an allegory for steroids.', 'I thought when revisiting this, it was going to be preachy Christian propaganda that I never noticed because I was a child, but it‚Äôs surprisingly‚Ä¶not? (Not completely)
It‚Äôs become a running joke to say ‚Äúthey don‚Äôt make them like they used to‚Äù when watching anything pre-2000s, but I find it especially true for something like 
Angels in the Outfield
. A children‚Äôs movie that is not only explicitly about faith, but also about the broken foster care system, absent parents, and the scars those leave on children. There isn‚Äôt a scene where they go to church to thank God for helping the Angels win or a moment where Danny Glover leads the team in prayer. Hard to believe that studios would‚Ä¶ 
more', 'When a young boy puts his faith in a higher power to bring his family back together through baseball ... miraculous things begin to happen around the ole ballpark. 
"It could happen!"
I will never forget the sound of surprised excitement my oldest son who is a solid little ball player had, when he first saw the angels swoop down in this since he had no idea that was coming. Angels in the Outfield might give you a toothache from how sweet it is, but it sure does make for a great feel-good family baseball flick.

Title: A Day in the¬†Country
Text:
The family of a Parisian shop-owner spends a day in the country. The daughter falls in love with a man at the inn, where they spend the¬†day.
['All of life‚Äôs pleasures.', "very beautiful little film about impermanence. the way renoir eases you into a light sex comedy before time and nature seems to be literally bent by a sudden expression of real love is very effectively done; the combination of the images of the rain disturbing the countryside and bataille's stare as she realizes the moment will be over just as soon as the rain is is very moving. but what happened to the cat, jean? the people need to know", '"To say Renoir captures action is to say his cinema is one of gestures, movement, emotions, smiles, tears, and kisses. While typically known for a use of deep focus, his formal patterns are more elusive than such a description could suggest. He rarely repeats shots and refuses to establish space, but in lieu of these filmic patterns he captures something akin to contemporary realism. This occurs both in the film‚Äôs visual sense of the world around them ‚Äî trees move their limbs, the air can feel a bit hazy ‚Äî and the fact that Renoir‚Äôs characters are hardly saints. Perhaps it‚Äôs not a shock that the two fishermen first announce themselves as archetypes (the hopeless romantic and the philanderer) only‚Ä¶ \nmore']

Title: Teen¬†Wolf

Title: Ballad of a¬†Soldier
Text:
During World War II, earnest young Russian soldier Alyosha Skvortsov is rewarded with a short leave of absence for performing a heroic deed on the battlefield. Feeling homesick, he decides to visit his mother. Due to his kindhearted nature, however, Alyosha is repeatedly sidetracked by his efforts to help those he encounters, including a lovely girl named Shura. In his tour of a country devastated by war, he struggles to keep hope¬†alive.
['Between a war film, a road movie and a love story, "Ballad of a Soldier" shows us how war kills everything that is human.', "#Watchlist 2021
Ballad of a Soldier
 is a poem of egoless humanity on a train ride home. It is less a war and more of a road movie since the action takes place as far away from the battlefield as possible. The movie's greatest strength is inarguably its egolessness ‚Äì it tells the story of a 19-year-old pure heart soldier on his way home for a short leave to visit his mother. He meets people on the way and gets enmeshed in their lives, always looking to help them any way he can. He goes through life's everyday adventures as he boards and gets off trains: he is held up, delayed a couple of times, finds new ways to go‚Ä¶ 
more", '***One of the best 150 films I have ever seen.***
Three years before Andrei Tarkovsky made his first feature film Ivanovo Detstvo (1962) and became one of the most extraordinary directors of all time, war veteran Grigori Chukhrai wrote and directed a memorable and considerably beloved anti-war statement called Ballada o Soldate. This beautiful cinematographic achievement was basically one of the first films that accurately portrayed the human side of people that were involved in the war and the cataclysmic aftermath caused in an environment surrounded by hopelessness and chaos.
This remarkably respected and revolutionary war masterpiece is set on the times of World War II and opens on the Russian battlefront against the Germans where a young nineteen-year-old Russian‚Ä¶ 
more']

Title: In a Year with 13¬†Moons
Text:
Elvira Weishaupt, once a burly working-class butcher, has made an enormous sacrifice for love. She has undergone a sex change for a romantic interest who has abandoned her, and she now must struggle to reconcile her past life with her present¬†identity.
["The unfortunate fact that Fassbinder chose to use a pseudo-trans woman as his vessel for exploring the agony of unrequited love mars this poetic trauma. That's what this is; not a film, not an expression, not an exploration, not a vivid image. It is the trauma itself projected onto the screen. \nI hesitate on most films to refer only to the director as the creator of a film, but it seems fair on this one, since Fassbinder did everything but the acting, to talk of it in terms of what Fassbinder intended. And he clearly intended this as a catharsis, a weapon against his pain, a confession, a desperate plea. This film is what it feels like to lose someone‚Ä¶ \nmore", 'How am I supposed to focus on the subtitles with the cows in the background?', 'Something really dark possesses this movie. Probably one of the finest films of the seventies. Left me absolutely speechless.']

Title: Frantz
Text:

The emotions are delicate and powerful. There did come a point where I was ready for it to move on, though, rather than lingering eternally in the aching void of longing and uncertainty. The use of color to indicate emotion in an otherwise black-and-white film is so on the nose, and yet it's also so effective.", '-"You like this painting too?"
- "Yes, It makes me want to live."
I finally found a film by Fran√ßois Ozon that resonated with me, a film that touched me deeply, a film that I found romantic. My prejudices against him were buried along with 
Frantz
. If I were to describe 
Frantz
 in one word, it would be "delicate." More films should emerge that portray people, their psyches, their vulnerabilities, and their dilemmas with such tenderness and care. Title: Idiocracy

But when they arrive, they find a civilization so dumbed-down that they‚Äôre the smartest people¬†around.
['Here's the thing about Idiocracy. It's inventive, it's funny, it's packed with hilarious visual gags, but...
(1) It's smug.
(2) It perpetuates the idea that "idiocy" (as defined by the film) is hereditary. And the idea that natural selection must be permitted to function "correctly" if society is to endure. (Incidentally, this is also the subtext of many anti-welfare arguments, and, well, Triumph of the Will.) In the movie, a class of people - primarily low income people - are a population bomb that is likely to destroy society if it is not contained. Title: Swept¬†Away
Text:
A spoiled rich woman and a brutish Communist deckhand become stranded alone on a desert island after venturing away from their¬†cruise.
["An ugly communist revenge fantasy turns into a scathing story of (a) how oppressors teach oppression and (b) the deceptive power of bourgeois spectacle. There is no justice here; there is only viciousness. Gennarino abuses Raffaela not with regard for reforming her nor for helping his fellow workers, but out of spite. He claims he wants her to know how he feels when she abuses him, but ultimately, he proves to be as manipulative and foolish as she is. She uses him; he uses her. They each have their limits, but these limits are relics of even older systems of injustice (he balks at sodomizing her, for instance, and she won't get divorced). The role reversals repeat until the lines are blurred and all that is left is nastiness.
December count: 40/100", "Is 
Swept Away
 simple political allegory wrapped up in regressive gender ideas and a rape fantasy, or is there something more going on here? Most critics that I looked into either feel the former, or they argue that the politics of the film recontextualize the sexual abuse as a form of political revolt. None have argued that maybe the events on the island are not to be taken so straightforwardly, that perhaps the developing love between Giancarlo Giannini's Gennarino and Mariangela Melato's Raffaella is in its own way critical of cycles of violence and revenge scenarios.
I could be deluding myself. I don't know that much about Lina Wertmueller or her politics, and perhaps I'm defending this movie for the‚Ä¶ 
more", '"Who says a rich woman's automatically a whore? The Communist Party?"
Rough and queasy and pretty consistently funny. The multiple role reversals and political conflicts allegorically embedded here are frequently uncomfortable, occasionally downright offensive, and ultimately unsolvable, which to me at least makes this a rambunctious and quintessentially Italian sex comedy, some really thrilling exploitation filmmaking.']

Title: Thelma
Text:
When 93-year-old Thelma Post gets duped by a phone scammer pretending to be her grandson, she sets out on a treacherous quest across the city to reclaim what was taken from¬†her.
['"Squibb turned 93 on the set and insisted on doing most of her own stunts during the seven-week production."
Your move Tom Cruise.', 'how can zuckemborg let this happen!', 'Look at the bottoms of those trees. Look how gnarled they are, and yet they live.\xa0
Not enough movies attempt to have honest conversations about being elderly‚Äî sometimes I think it‚Äôs because we are mostly afraid of the truths, the reality and the anxieties of being a burden on the ones you love. 
Thelma
\xa0is not only unafraid to discuss them, but also has a blast poking fun at them. There is an acknowledgment that with age, there is a sense of identity loss, but it‚Äôs also a compelling reminder that despite how gnarled we may become, the human spirit remains very much intact.\xa0
Just rambling now, but I never met my grandparents and this really hit me good. Would imagine it hits harder for those with connections to the grandparents. It‚Äôs also the hardest I laughed and cried during this year‚Äôs Sundance, so there‚Äôs that to love about it.']

College student Janardhan is a simpleton who desperately seeks inspiration for the musician inside him. Although heartbreak helps him reach his goal, it also leads him to¬†self-destruction.

Rockstar
, in order to be a truly great artist, you've got to go through unimaginable emotional pain first. I call bullshit, but that doesn't mean that I won't watch or try to understand where the protagonist is coming from. Which I certainly did.
However, the strange premise proved to be the least of my problems concerning the film. 
Rockstar
 is disjointed, messy, and altogether silly, though it tries to present itself as a transcendental piece of film-making.
The casting choice for the female lead was horrible. Nargis Fakhri simply cannot act. At all. Every time she mouthed a dialogue, her eyebrows would rise and fall uncontrollably and make me laugh. And considering the fact that Fakhri plays a‚Ä¶ 
more", 'i wish i had simply watched all the music videos and pieced together a plot on my own.']

Title: Ouija: Origin of¬†Evil
Text:
In 1967 Los Angeles, a widowed mother and her two daughters add a new stunt to bolster their s√©ance scam business and unwittingly invite authentic evil into their home. When the youngest daughter is overtaken by the merciless spirit, this small family confronts unthinkable fears to save her and send her possessor back to the other¬†side.
["most people think horror freaks just love blood and guts, but mike flanagan knows that the real horror freaks love it because other movies don't really understand how painful sadness is", "The period-piece aesthetic is done absolutely brilliantly. The look and feel to this movie is awesome. Flanagan makes it really easy for the viewer to become immersed into this world. 
When Kids are in a horror movie they can make or break the film. Take 
The Witch
 for example. Not only did that film contain the best child acting I've ever seen in a horror film, but also some of the best child acting I've ever seen in any film period. In 
Ouija: Origin of Evil
 case, the child acting makes the movie! Lulu Wilson was pretty fantastic (she's the younger sister). I was genuinely afraid of her character. She says this line of dialogue to a male character that‚Ä¶ 
more", 'Flanagan is easily one of our most talented horror directors working with the big bad studios. 
Ouija: Origin of Evil
\xa0was a movie that seemed destined to fail and if the reins were anyone else‚Äôs hands, there‚Äôs a strong possibility it would have!
Fortunately Flanagan cooks here‚Äî split diopters, none of those lame loud music jump scares, good creepy child actors‚Äî this movie rocks.\xa0
Podcast- Ouija: Origin of Evil (part of Mike Flanagan month)']

Title: Take the Money and¬†Run
Text:
Virgil Starkwell is intent on becoming a notorious bank robber. Unfortunately for Virgil and his not-so-budding career, he is completely¬†incompetent.
['I once won a bunch of money on a game show by debating this was the funniest movie of all time. 
See?', 'Austin Powers theme song jumpscare!
I think in many ways this film is a victim of the hype that‚Äôs been building up through its reputation, especially with some calling it Allen‚Äôs funniest movie. And in that regard, this film disappointed me.
Don‚Äôt get me wrong, there are plenty of funny moments and lines. Little moments like the gypsies in the vault, the prisoner saying he was crazy, the iconic soap scene, and the cop saying he thought all the criminals were just a close family. It‚Äôs a film full of funny visual gags and lines. But I think the capita that landed for me wasn‚Äôt as high as 
Love and Death
 for example. One thing is for sure: I am‚Ä¶ 
more', "Woody Allen's first film proper is a mock documentary and focuses on the life and times of an incompetent criminal. The comedy ranges from sharp and witty to ridiculous, but either way the jokes come at you pretty fast and many of them work well. Allen takes the lead role himself and the character ends up becoming the same bumbling neurotic that he plays in all of his comedy films. Of course, he's cast opposite the beautiful woman too, another trademark Woody Allen feature! The film is essentially a collection of set pieces, mostly centred around a single gag - the best of which involve two awkward bank robberies and a chain gang escape. It does become a little repetitive in places and the story sags somewhat in the middle - but for the most part this is an amusing comedy, and a interesting precursor of better things to come."]

Title: The Big¬†Year
Text:

["ME: Why do I relate to this dumb movie about men ignoring their families and social responsibilities simply to inflate some number?
[looks at letterboxd 'this year' total]

I just don't know what to say, this sucked.", "Well, Birding is a hobby that gives me great pleasure, coupled with photography, so of course I enjoyed this totally light adorable movie. 
I also found that the story was developed in a kinda original way, without some basic clich√© elements of a dramatic comedy plot (those usual conflicts that we all know). There's no conflict. I guess this is a movie for birdwatchers only.
Yes. I'm giving 5 stars to a Jack Black movie, but this is a totally PERSONAL rating, ok? Of course most people will find the movie boring as hell."]

Title: Hugo
Text:
Orphaned and alone except for an uncle, Hugo Cabret lives in the walls of a train station in 1930s Paris. Hugo‚Äôs job is to oil and maintain the station‚Äôs clocks, but to him, his more important task is to protect a broken automaton and notebook left to him by his late father. Accompanied by the goddaughter of an embittered toy merchant, Hugo embarks on a quest to solve the mystery of the automaton and find a place he can call¬†home.
['I have a canker sore on my left tonsil. Every time I move anything, eat anything, or swallow it feels like someone is stabbing my throat. Based on past experiences I‚Äôm assuming I got it because of stress. It‚Äôs finals week, I‚Äôm applying for internships, I‚Äôm in the midst of pre-production for a short film I‚Äôm shooting in a few weeks, and I‚Äôm trying to find time to watch all of Scorsese‚Äôs films.\xa0\nMy mind is a tornado right now and my body is in pain, but for 2 hours and 6 minutes Scorsese guided me through a story full of childlike wonder that I haven‚Äôt felt since I was, well, a child. Everything disappeared and cinema took over in a genuinely beautiful and moving way. Now\xa0back to finding some ointment for this canker sore.', 'one of the only movies about ‚Äúthe magic of the movies‚Äù that actually captures just how miraculous cinema can be. a way for us to connect together, even just for a few hours, to see worlds and images that were considered impossible. it moves me beyond words to know that one of cinema‚Äôs greatest treasurers made a film for kids about how beautiful the artwork is, creating the same effect for an entire generation that he received from old prints in a library. we come to movies on our own paths through life but what matters is that we‚Äôre all here now, together, united by celluloid.', 'Where were all the French people?']

Title: Green¬†Zone
Text:
During the U.S.-led occupation of Baghdad in 2003, Chief Warrant Officer Roy Miller and his team of Army inspectors are dispatched to find weapons of mass destruction believed to be stockpiled in the Iraqi desert. Rocketing from one booby-trapped and treacherous site to the next, the men search for deadly chemical agents but stumble instead upon an elaborate cover-up that threatens to invert the purpose of their¬†mission.
["Pretty smart political action thriller or gripping documentary about cameramen suffering from Parkinson's disease.
I'm not quite sure yet....", 'There are still many delusional souls out there who believe that United States' invasion of Iraq was a justified move and not an excuse to pursue its own interests. Using the veil of democracy, America went to war despite opposition from United Nations and, in the process, didn't just destabilise the entire Middle-East but also plunged Iraq into its still ongoing chaos.
Green Zone
 is, at least on paper, a valiant attempt to show the corruption within the United States government and argues that the whole "disarming Iraq from weapons of mass destruction" was a charade, that the Bush administration manipulated evidence to gain public support, and that America itself is solely responsible for the sorry state Iraq has been‚Ä¶ 
more', 'Matt Damon is so in the Green Zone,

Title: Cape¬†Fear
Text:
Sam Bowden witnesses a rape committed by Max Cady and testifies against him. When released after 8 years in prison, Cady begins stalking Bowden and his family but is always clever enough not to violate the¬†law.
['a series of expertly-crafted inky, sweaty, voyeuristic suspense sequences tied together by the troubling contradiction of trying to contain primal instincts of sex, rage and violence within a civil/legal framework. robert mitchum the goat. thompson directs the hell out of it', "Move over, Anton Chigurh. Sit back down, Hannibal Lector. Step aside, Harry Powell. Max Cady has come to town, and he thinks you're all a bunch of pansies.
It's one thing to put on a performance that overshadows all other aspects of an otherwise good film. It's another to put on one that pulls the rest of a good film into greatness. Robert Mitchum, whom I have ashamedly not experienced much of, gives such a show here in 
Cape Fear
. Yes, the score by Bernard Herrmann, ominous and accentuating rather than intrusive, didn't need much help. And yes, Gregory Peck et. al. do just fine on their own (especially so for Polly Bergen as his wife and Barrie Chase as‚Ä¶ 
more", 'When a justice system is so broken that it can‚Äôt put down a monster, maybe it‚Äôs time that the system itself gets put down.\xa0
J. Lee Thompson‚Äôs ‚ÄúCape Fear‚Äù blows the figments remaining of noir‚Äôs ‚Äôwrong man‚Äô trope clean out of the water. Robert Mitchum‚Äôs role as the unreformed rapist Max Cary isn‚Äôt just the wrong man. He‚Äôs the wrongest of all men. So there must be something askew with a legal process that he can use perpetually to his advantage.\xa0
The answer, though, is that even men in the right manipulate a flawed system to their own end, after realizing it won‚Äôt always come to their defense. This, though, only ravages an already frayed set of functions down the‚Ä¶ 
more']

Title: Turbo¬†Kid
Text:
In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, an orphaned teen must battle a ruthless warlord to save the girl of his¬†dreams.
['Imagine Sam Raimi and James Cameron got together to make a Mega Man movie for a buck twenty-five.', "The year is 1997. In a post-apocalyptic world where water is king; an orphaned kid named The Kid spends his days riding his BMX bike and scavenging the edges of the wasteland searching for anything he can use to trade to a local bartender for his favorite comic book, Turbo Rider. You see, Turbo Rider is a superhero, who does super things. The comic causes The Kid's imagination to run wild, and he dreams of becoming a superhero. One day, while roaming the dirt roads, he meets a charming young lady named Apple. The next day, he accidentally finds a Super Power Glove that turns him into a bootleg version of Turbo Rider. Along with a cowboy arm-wrestling champion named‚Ä¶ 
more", "There have been many films of late that try to capture the vibe of days gone by, of iconic cinematic eras and in doing so pay tribute to them. There haven't been any that have done this as successfully as Turbo Kid. 
A common pitfall is losing yourself in your tribute and going so far overboard that you're almost overindulging in stylistic mannerisms. Trying too hard will only make you come across as desperate. The thing that Turbo Kid does so well (and this is the main reason for me giving it full marks) is being genuine. This is a genuine labour of love. An attempt to not make a tribute to the glorious 80s but to actually make a‚Ä¶ 
more"]

Title: My Week with¬†Marilyn
Text:
London, 1956. Genius actor and film director Laurence Olivier is about to begin the shooting of his upcoming movie, premiered in 1957 as The Prince and the Showgirl, starring Marilyn Monroe. Young Colin Clark, who dreams on having a career in movie business, manages to get a job on the set as third assistant¬†director.
['Friendly reminder: Michelle Williams is the best American actress working today. Nobody comes close; she is a fucking godsend to contemporary cinema and we are very lucky to have her with us, gracing the silver screen on a timely basis. With that said, I turn my thoughts to 
My Week with Marilyn
, Simon Curtis‚Äô prosaic yet sprightly biopic of legendary Hollywood movie star Marilyn Monroe focusing on her 1957 collaboration with Shakespearean thespian-cum-filmmaker Laurence Olivier in 
The Prince and the Showgirl
. It‚Äôs based on the memoirs of Colin Clark, Olivier‚Äôs third assistant director at the time who had a fleeting, wistful fling with the screen goddess during her stay in Britain. I often found myself questioning the veracity of some‚Ä¶ 
more', "michelle williams' performance as marilyn utterly dominates the film, her acting's spectacular; it's done with such compassion and believably. she nails monroe's smile, walk and mannerisms, all while managing to not drift into a caricature of her. it's a multilayered performance that goes further than simply just an impersonation; there's erratic mixtures of glamour and vulnerability, she fabulously evokes both the timid woman and the outlandish celebrity construct that was marilyn monroe", 'Marilyn Monroe in her natural habitat, the bath.']

Title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs¬†2
Text:
After the disastrous food storm in the first film, Flint and his friends are forced to leave the town. Flint accepts the invitation from his idol Chester V to join The Live Corp Company, which has been tasked to clean the island, and where the best inventors in the world create technologies for the betterment of mankind. When Flint discovers that his machine still operates and now creates mutant food beasts like living pickles, hungry tacodiles, shrimpanzees and apple pie-thons, he and his friends must return to save the¬†world. √ó
["Y'all are really mean to this movie it's cute üò≠ I'm gonna go play some Bugsnax now", "THERE'S A LEEK IN THE BOAT", 'The funniest part of the movie was when "live" being "evil" backwards became a viable justification for the big corporation being outed.']

Title: Speed 2: Cruise¬†Control
Text:
A disgruntled former employee hijacks the Seabourn Legend cruise liner. Set on a fixed course, without any means of communication and at the mercy of the hijacker, it‚Äôs up to the one cop on vacation, and his soon to be fianc√© (hopefully) Annie, to regain control of it before it kills the passengers and causes an environmental disaster. Insurmountable and daunting tasks await them on their perilous journey throughout the ship trying to fend off the hijacker and save the¬†passengers. √ó
['Why does this exist.', 'Willem Dafoe has a jar of leeches who he refers to as his boys', "I can't make a case for this being actually good...the script is a loose but amusing jumble of nonsense and cliche, and it bugs me that all the best action beats get handed over to Jason Patric while Bullock screeches and stutters. But I've always had a soft spot for it on a technical level. Whole chunks were shot on an actual cruise liner, and along with Eastwood's old DP Jack Green, Jan de Bont (despite his taste in material never in the habit of directing ugly films) does a great job maintaining geography even though the cramped quarters necessitate everything go handheld. The maze-like ship interiors are filled with anamorphic lens flares, which makes the whole thing look not-too-infrequently‚Ä¶ \nmore"]

Title: jeen-yuhs: A Kanye¬†Trilogy
Text:
The lives of an emerging superstar and a filmmaker intertwine in this intense, intimate docuseries charting Kanye West‚Äôs career, filmed over two¬†decades.
['our theater had technical issues so the movie started at 8:30 instead of 7:30, so i got the true kanye experience', 'part 3 is as turbulent as it should be, don‚Äôt really know if that‚Äôs a good or bad thing. as a whole, this series isn‚Äôt as much a comprehensive character study as it is a tribute to his process and dedication. i really like his music so i really liked the doc. also worth recognizing that you can make an entire separate doc about what‚Äôs happened to kanye since part 1 premiered at sundance. who‚Äôs to say how much coodie would even touch on that recent stuff, the whole doc seems relatively disinterested in the drama and more interested in how kanye‚Äôs vision of himself has stayed so consistent over time but in different forms. and i think that makes for a fascinating doc. it at the very least reshaped how i listen to some of his music. feeling satisfied, inspired, and impressed at how well edited this ended up being', 'Omg the name sounds like genius']

Title: The Hills Have Eyes¬†2
Text:
A group of National Guard trainees on a routine mission find themselves up against cannibalistic mutants in the New Mexico¬†desert.
['The hills can keep my eyes, because this was horrible.
I‚Äôve never watched this sequel before, even though I‚Äôve had plenty of chances, and the first thing that needs to be said is that this is much more brutal, more gory, and overall the film relies way too heavily on its shock value which makes it feel far too exploitative. And how it differs from the first one becomes clear pretty quickly. This movie isn‚Äôt scary at all...it‚Äôs more disgusting and in a bad way.
The setup is really weak, and we‚Äôre introduced to ‚Äúthe best(worst) military unit you‚Äôve ever seen,‚Äù which feels completely unearned. And I think Wes did that on purpose? But the dialogue is full of cliches‚Ä¶ 
more', 'I shouldn‚Äôt have been as shocked as I was by the amount of sexual violence 
The Hills Have Eyes 2
 has considering it was written by Wes Craven, but 
jesus
... They\xa0really thought they were doing something with that. Spoiler: they were not doing something with that.\xa0
What helped 2006\xa0
The Hills Have Eyes
 remake thrive feels completely discarded here in lieu of even more graphic violence. The sequel definitely speaks to the times of its production, an era of horror filmmaking grounded in its full throttle torture porn. There‚Äôs a lot to process here but none of it ever truly feels impactful. Before you can marvel at the horror just shown, things have already moved on to the next grotesque act‚Ä¶ 
more', 'This is like idiot 
Predator
. Feels like a second rate/silly but fun 80‚Äôs slasher made in the 2000‚Äôs so it‚Äôs right on par with the OG 
HHE2... 
which is pretty rough but I actually liked that movie better than this
.\xa0
Big step down from Aja‚Äôs facemelter but there‚Äôs still some stupid doofy goofball shenanigans to be had and although I didn‚Äôt like it as much as I had in the past I still have some weird soft spot for this thing.']

Title: ParaNorman
Text:
In the town of Blithe Hollow, Norman Babcock can speak to the dead, but no one other than his eccentric new friend believes his ability is real. One day, Norman‚Äôs eccentric uncle tells him of a ritual he must perform to protect the town from a curse cast by a witch centuries¬†ago.
['"What do you think you\'re doing firing on civilians? That\'s for the police to do!"', 'But we need the movie to show the boyfriend', 'me watching any movie about an outcast: so in this metaphor for the queer experience we see the chara-']

Title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the¬†Horse
Text:
The unlikely friendship of a boy, a mole, a fox and a horse traveling together in the boy‚Äôs search for¬†home.
['Not so much a story as a collection of characters spouting unbearably schmaltzy one-liners taken directly from a self-help book. The filmic equivalent of a Live Laugh Love poster.', 'started crying the second I saw how the mole walked', 'Cute story and beautiful animation but every single line is trying to be ‚Äúthat line‚Äù which creates a really broken narrative. It‚Äôs like all the characters are having a competition to out quote each other lol.']

Title: Hardcore¬†Henry
Text:
Henry, a newly resurrected cyborg who must save his wife/creator from the clutches of a psychotic tyrant with telekinetic powers, AKAN, and his army of mercenaries. Fighting alongside Henry is Jimmy, who is Henry‚Äôs only hope to make it through the day. Hardcore Henry takes place over the course of one day, in Moscow,¬†Russia.
['Headache-inducing Henry', '74/100
A desecration of everything and anything deemed tolerable, appropriate, or inherently cinematic; 
Hardcore Henry
 seems to have been created through the manipulation of a gaming controller rather than through the movement of actors and spaces, direction and cinematography, writing and editing. The audience's protagonist is unable to speak (which makes for some great physical comedy), its main "plot" revolves around a checklist of objectives, and the violence is without consequence - it's like an arcade game with one of those toy guns as a controller - until it's necessary for the "plot" to continue barreling towards another action setpiece. 
But this is what 
Hardcore Henry
 wants to be. It isn't in love with itself. It IS itself. No pretension,‚Ä¶ 
more', "Some see this as an insult to cinema, some see this as a clever merging of mediums. For me though, it's totally legit. If you hate the gimmick already the movie does nothing to change your mind, in fact it will only reinforce your opinion. 
Hardcore Henry
 is a literal adrenaline injection, it's hilarious, dizzying, and fun as hell, does first person pew pew pews better than a video game ever could. The camera movement is all over the place but the magical thing is: you can always tell what's going on. The musical cues are flawlessly on point and Sharlto Copley is a tremendous joy to watch, both adds a new layer of entertainment onto this splatterfest.
It's a big, messy pile of trash that I wholeheartedly approve."]

Title: Sound of¬†Freedom
Text:
The story of Tim Ballard, a former US government agent, who quits his job in order to devote his life to rescuing children from global sex¬†traffickers.
['A movie about reuniting stolen children with their families, brought to you by the people who gleefully supported separating immigrant families at the border.
Splits the difference between QAnon bait and regular flavor right-wing Christian ‚Äúconservative cinema.‚Äù Exploitation movie filtered through the church doesn‚Äôt hit right but the bigger issue is all the boring cliches
Disingenuous in several different ways but I like that people think it‚Äôs well-meaning and important instead of a 
misleading sensationalized grift
 lining people‚Äôs pockets and doing fuck all to stop trafficking but these folks have a tough time with reality', "This was fine. I'm glad a film shines a light on this topic, and I hope it sparks legislation to protect victims of such crimes and crack down on the perpetrators.
Unfortunately the film is overdramatized and averse to nuance. Child trafficking is not just stealing screaming children. It's more often manipulating and exploiting teenagers in a grooming process, often by a person close to you, which isn't depicted here because the audience... wouldn't be sophisticated enough to understand that that is still abuse? Or maybe because it was more concerned with Ballard looking like a badass hero slinging little girls over his shoulder? I'm not sure.
But um... are people alright out there? Seeing the discourse online I'm afraid‚Ä¶ 
more", 'The ‚Äúspecial message‚Äù after the credits is probably the weirdest call-to-action I‚Äôve ever seen.
Help stop human trafficking by‚Ä¶ buying more tickets to this movie?? Okay bud.']

Title: Beverly Hills¬†Ninja
Text:
Haru, an orphaned American who washes ashore in Japan and is mistaken for the great White Ninja of legend. Raised among the finest Ninjas, Haru grows strong and big - very big. With the grace of all Three Stooges rolled into one body, Haru is an embarrassment to his clan. But when a beautiful blonde pleads for his help, Haru is given one dangerous, disastrously funny chance to prove¬†himself.
["Ya know what makes me happy?
Chris Farley.
Ya know what makes me sad?
He was so disappointed in Beverly Hills Ninja (1997) that he cried on his agent's shoulder after the first screening. He told his agent that he never wanted to do such a film again. Farley's stance was justified as it arguably attributed to the exploitation of his manic, physical humor by dumbing it down and playing it out to an almost tiring and foolish degree.
What's a shame about this film in particular, while I appreciate it's die-hard fans and what they like about the movie, is seeing Farley's huge potential in physical comedy (that the public was well aware of at this point in his‚Ä¶ 
more", 'Fun fact this is Christian Bale‚Äôs favorite movie‚Äîimagine that!', "I can't in good concious give this a low rating. 
My whole childhood consisted of me watching a VHS of Beverly Hills Ninja I had recorded off of TV on repeat."]

Title: Glass¬†Onion
Text:
World-famous detective Benoit Blanc heads to Greece to peel back the layers of a mystery surrounding a tech billionaire and his eclectic crew of¬†friends.
["calling it glass onion is such a coward's way to avoid calling it chives out", 'the biggest mystery to hit the greek islands since sophie sheridan invited her three potential fathers to her wedding', 'A full two hours and twenty minutes of me throwing back my head cackling and clapping my hands with delight']

Title: The¬†Damned
Text:
In the early days of Nazi Germany, a powerful noble family must adjust to life under the new dictatorship¬†regime.
['Less than a century after Italian unification, national democracy had already begun to rot.\xa0
Luchino Visconti‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Damned‚Äù depicts the sagging structure of a society with an extravagant facade, built around a frame than could never sustain its weight of its own decadence.\xa0
‚ÄúThe Damned‚Äù is a thinly veiled allegory about a true life German industrial family that supplied the Nazis with steel in order to retain and grow their social standing. Which - was never questionable at the outset. These were never back room dealings to parlay mediocrity into affluence, but parlour exchanges where power begat more power.\xa0
‚ÄúDamned‚Äù is a dramatic departure in style by Visconti. The soapy camp and glamor from ‚ÄúSandra‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Leopard‚Äù re-emerge. But‚Ä¶ 
more', "The Damned is crazy, disturbing and heart-wrenching. As a grim insight into the 1930s Germany where nazis had just took over power, Luchino Visconti opted for a microscopic approach, reflecting the madness of the German society as a whole, through the entry point of a high class German family, where family members are vying for power and control even at the cost of each other's life, and the end result is one of the most devastating and memorable accounts of nazism you would ever see.
What sets The Damned apart is its abundant elements of sexual perversions, exclusively from the character of Martin, played by a dangerously magnificent Helmut Berger, whose ocean-blue eyes and deceivingly boyish frailty Visconti never skipped‚Ä¶ 
more", 'This is just\xa0
Succession\xa0
(2018)\xa0Nazi Edition, and Helmut Berger‚Äôs character is definitely
\xa0
Roman.']

Title: Chime
Text:
A chef‚Äôs life is disrupted by a chime that brings with it an increasing sense of¬†dread.
["Formalism comes naturally to Kurosawa, like walking or breathing; his frames, never ostentatious, somehow go from spare to pressurized without visible manipulation. Chime, which runs 45 minutes long, is , like so many of KK's films, a diabolical paradox, an exercise in control describing a plague of dissociative behaviour; it could be a sequel to Cure except that there's no psychic terrorist at the center, only a kind of free-floating, ambient madness that seems to pass freely between people and spaces, and maybe thrugh the screen as well. I'm certainly not feeling very well at the moment...", "Invisible sounds of the modern world: putting out the trash, balancing work and family, between art and profit, all while dealing with a progressive existential alienation that slowly contaminates everything, even the actual matter of the world. A hitchcockian yarn plagued by Kurosawa's eerie, ghostly formal games, both visual and especially sonorous. Nobody conveys contemporary social malaise quite so effectively, nor so precisely. That murder sequence under the difracting lights and sounds of the train was great.", "Uncanny and existentially terrifying in a way that I haven't felt since the first time I saw Cure and Pulse. Not the first to mention this on this website but this is Kiyoshi with the B subplots stripped out until it's almost pure form, practically abstract. More than an exercise in my opinion, everyday modern alienation pared down to abstract terror - almost like a horror Antonioni. Disassociation is always around the corner - I haven't been this unsettled by a movie in years.\nAnd as always with the later Kiyoshi pictures it's also a little masterclass in directing, but even more stripped down and essential here: not a shot is wasted, and it seems like not a second is wasted as well."]

Title: The Blue¬†Trail
Text:
In the name of economic recovery, the Brazilian Government created a perennial system of compulsory vertical isolation for seniors over 80 to be confined in a colony. Teca is 77 and lives in the village of Muriti, in the Amazon, when she is surprised by the announcement of the age reduction, including her age group. Cornered, Teca makes an intriguing journey hidden from the officers amidst rivers, boats and the underworld to clandestinely try to fulfill her last dream, to take a plane¬†ride. √ó
['transita entre o realismo m√°gico e a distopia fundamentalista e tecnol√≥gica: um mundo pr√≥prio, profundamente brasileiro, inconfundivelmente latino-americano e radicalmente otimista com sua pr√≥pria linguagem e mitologia vibrante e uma das protagonistas mais interessantes do cinema contempor√¢neo, uma mulher que sonha em ver o mundo de cima, cheia de estrat√©gias e disposta a viajar o mundo e absorver tudo que encontra. narrativa episodica, que remete a contos de fada e aventuras de fantasia medieval em que a cada cap√≠tulo o her√≥i (her√≥ina) - n√£o o da jornada - confronta um estranho enigma que pode ou n√£o ser decifrado. tudo isso com aquele sabor de america latina e um poderos√≠ssimo jogo de imagens que n√£o subestima o espectador nem pega ningu√©m pela m√£o. cinema pernambucano t√° muito bem representado aqui. coisa linda de ver.', 'coming of age de idosa', 'queria um beijo l√©sbico :(']

Title: Early¬†Man
Text:
Dug, along with his sidekick Hognob, unite a cavemen tribe to save their hidden valley from being spoiled and, all together as a team, to face the menace of a mysterious and mighty enemy, on the turf of an ancient and sacred¬†sport.
['claymation movies that are just ok are still better than anything illumination entertainment puts out', 'god i lose my shit every time i see an aardman bunny!!!! this studio makes the cutest claymation bunnies and they KNOW it. glad to see a bunny in this flick ‚Äî aardman‚Äôs really giving the people what we want (more bunnies)', 'I‚Äôm going to be honest, I have absolutely no idea why people are giving this low ratings. I loved it so much. I can‚Äôt think of many reasons why I loved it so much, I mean the storyline is extremely basic and predictable. BUT ITS SO MUCH FUN. I‚Äôm thinking about it now and it was just ... perfect. The humour is amazing, it‚Äôs quite obviously made for kids but I laughed out loud over and over again. Aardman animation is legendary, and I will not accept people claiming that it‚Äôs ‚Äúuninspired‚Äù as I read earlier. I grew up with Aardman movies and I don‚Äôt know as I only loved this for sentimental reasons. At the end of the day, whatever the reason, I loved it very very much.']

Title: Rye¬†Lane
Text:
Two twenty-somethings, both reeling from bad break-ups, connect over the course of an eventful day in South London ‚Äì helping each other deal with their nightmare exes, and potentially restoring their faith in¬†romance.

Title: Three¬†Kings
Text:
A group of American soldiers stationed in Iraq at the end of the Gulf War find a map they believe will take them to a huge cache of stolen Kuwaiti gold hidden near their base, and they embark on a secret mission that‚Äôs destined to change¬†everything.
['very politically astute for a heist film and very tragic for a comedy. i was quite amazed by what it turned into - this could not have been made post 9/11, especially since mark wahlberg‚Äôs character would have stopped 9/11', "Shocked at how many times I almost cried during this movie! Especially shocked that Mark Wahlberg was the one that got me closest! I'll never forgive him for this. His greatest transgression. \nEverything I'd wanna say was said by \nthis review!", "I decided to move this up to a full five-star rating because there's really nothing I can think of that I don't love about it. It's not an absolutely perfect film, but in terms of fantastic performances, cinematography, score, editing, pacing and the perfect blend of action/comedy/drama; it's an exceptional one where no faults have any effect on my overall experience with it."]

Title: Swing¬†Girls
Text:
A tale of delinquent and lazy school girls. In their efforts to cut remedial summer math class, they end up poisoning and replacing the school‚Äôs brass¬†band.
['Puberty is when teenage boys and girls start thinking about nothing but sax all the time.', "There are 2 kinds of movies in this world. Movies that swing and movies that don't.", "Meeting jazz. Food poisoning the brass band. Accidentally killing a boar and getting rewarded for it. Selling a Playstation console for instruments. Everyone in the cast whose character plays their respective instruments learned for real behind the scenes. Hawaii. The brilliant chemistry. Small and giant landing comedic moments. Slacking to swinging. And a boy. Pure joy, just teenagers making themselves and the world better through musical influence. Jazz mouse. The hyperactive energy of 
Dance With Me
 may win over me more, but 
Swing Girls

Title: The Lodger: A Story of the London¬†Fog
Text:
London. A mysterious serial killer brutally murders young blond women by stalking them in the night fog. One foggy, sinister night, a young man who claims his name is Jonathan Drew arrives at the guest house run by the Bunting family and rents a¬†room.
['if she‚Äôs your girl then why‚Äôs she in a towel quietly conversing with me through her bathroom door', 'Like a deep-seeded childhood trauma, Hitchcock‚Äôs obsession with blondes begins in the infancy of his career.\xa0
What he himself proclaimed as the first real ‚ÄòHitchcock film,‚Äô ‚ÄúThe Lodger: A Story of the London Fog‚Äù reveals that Hitchcock‚Äôs talent, style, and his compulsions - came naturally. Maybe, with a little German ancestry.\xa0
Arriving back in Britain from time spent in Berlin\xa0as an assistant director, Hitchcock allowed influences from German expressionism to seep fully into every crevice of ‚ÄúThe Lodger.‚Äù Populated with sharp angles and looming shadows, ‚ÄúLodger‚Äôs‚Äù heritage is without debate. Where it begins to become distinctly Hitchcock; is how it all looks so‚Ä¶ 
romantic
.\xa0
‚ÄúThe Lodger,‚Äù starring Ivor Novello as the delicate outline of a Jack the Ripper character (just‚Ä¶ 
more', 'Love seeing Hitchcock‚Äôs familiar obsessions turn up so early on in his career... blondes, foreshadowing, the cameo, and the\xa0wrong man scenario.\xa0Blueprints for a career laced with Sex, murder, and shadows.
The Lodger is stacked with ominous camera angles and top notch lighting that accentuated the suspense in a similar fashion as Lang and Murnau did, the influences were a welcomed late night/half in the bag cinematic treat and I can‚Äôt believe how much better this movie was than I remembered. I was fixated on the screen... totally admiring the technique and visual eye on display here, the chandelier swaying back and forth and that staircase seen are a chefs kiss‚Äîthat hand sliding down the bannister like some Nosferatu serpent won‚Äôt be leaving my thoughts anytime soon.\xa0
Love this movie.']

Title: The Kissing Booth¬†3

Title: Blindspotting
Text:
Collin must make it through his final three days of probation for a chance at a new beginning. He and his troublemaking childhood best friend, Miles, work as movers, and when Collin witnesses a police shooting, the two men‚Äôs friendship is tested as they grapple with identity and their changed realities in the rapidly-gentrifying neighborhood they grew up¬†in.
['Blindspotting is the kind of film that provokes hours of conversation. Only masterpieces and memorably terrible movies do that, and this film is the former.', 'There have been multiple great movies this year that frame Oakland as the center of contemporary urban life to show how strongly people of color are affected by systemic issues like colonization, capitalism, gentrification, the prison system, and crime. Each does a great job of not just trying to paint Oakland as a bullet-ridden battleground, the way Republicans choose to depict Chicago whenever it‚Äôs convenient‚Äì they paint the city as it is: colorful, vibrant, exciting, communal, full of love, full of humor, full of people.
\xa0
They do this because they love Oakland, and understand that, like any city, Oakland is not the sum of its issues, it‚Äôs the sum of its people and the way they fight against said issues. It‚Äôs‚Ä¶ 
more', '‚Äúi am both pictures. see both pictures!‚Äù
unbelievably well made: hilarious and meaningful with an honest beating heart at the core. an absolute must see of the year']

Title: Night of the Living¬†Dead
Text:
A ragtag group barricade themselves in an old Pennsylvania farmhouse to remain safe from a horde of flesh-eating ghouls ravaging the¬†Northeast.
["Dear 1968:
We made a film that has the following:
-Female protagonist.

George A. Romero
Influencer of Horror, American Independent Film & Italian Horror Cinema

Title: Real¬†Life

Title: Wag the¬†Dog

distracts\xa0from his affair by starting a fake war in albania and then a year later bill clinton distracts from 
his 
affair by starting a real war in iraq... satire is dead', 'Bill Clinton watched this movie and thought ‚Äúholy fuck that‚Äôs a good idea!‚Äù', 'Calling this movie quietly prophetic is one thing, calling it a full on horror disguised as a buddy comedy is another. I‚Äôm firmly in the latter category, as I was frankly disturbed by the time I completed this Barry Levinson picture. Dustin Hoffman and Robert De Niro riffing David Mamet dialogue off of each other is a recipe for an offbeat banger. Hoffman is channeling the late Robert Evans here, while De Niro is trying to be anything but a hard ass mobster. Both electrify the screen as they always have in this novelty of the late 90s.\xa0
Levinson shoots this dry, cynical script like

Title: Driveways
Text:
Eight-year-old Cody is spending the summer in an unfamiliar setting with his mom Kathy. Though he can‚Äôt relate to the neighbourhood kids, things take an unexpected turn when he develops an unusual friendship with grouchy old Del from next¬†door.
["* Really great movie. It manages to say profound things about childhood, middle age and old age (thus covers the whole human life) in just 1 hour and 23 minutes running time. And it manages to do so while also telling a brilliant story filled with brilliant details. And it is very entertaining. Isn't that just phenomenal? 
* I have never seen a movie which uses two characters who are dead so effectively for the story. They are made to seem alive by the outstanding writing. Thus it also says profound things about death. So for anyone who is keeping score, that is whole human life and death covered meaningfully. What more can a movie do? 
* Though this point‚Ä¶ 
more", "Cut from fabrics similar to Kogonada's 
Columbus
‚Äîin its tenderness, its minimalism, its tinge of pathos.
The three wonderful leads carry 
Driveways

Best First Screenplay

Every smile this film brought to my face caused heartache; it's so delicate, precious, and quietly moving.", "73
Warm, gentle, carries itself like a soft breeze on a summer day. One of Brian Dennehy's last performances. He's beyond incredible in it, as expected."]

Title: Sore: Wife from the¬†Future
Text:
A young man living alone in Croatia encounters a woman who claims to be his wife from the future, sent on a mission to help him correct his bad habits and improve his¬†lifestyle.
['Saya bukan kritikus film, jadi izinkan saya berbagi perasaan dan pengalaman pribadi saja untuk menjawab pertanyaan ini. Tentang film Sore, amat jarang ada film yang membuat kita kesulitan menampung luapan pikiran dan berbagai emosi sekaligus. Ia memenuhi indra, logika, dan jiwa pada saat bersamaan, lalu meninggalkan jejak rasa yang kuat dan bertahan begitu lama.
Film Sore memanjakan mata dengan visual yang begitu indah. Bukan hanya lansekap indah Kroasia dan Finlandia (dan juga Tebet Eco Park üòâ), namun lokasi dalam ruangnya pun indah. Sedangkan telinga kita dibuai oleh musik-musik yang menawan. Lagu Terbuang Dalam Waktu oleh Barasuara menjadi bagian tak terpisahkan dari film ini. Lagu yang kini menjadi jembatan memori bila kita ingin mengulangi perasaan yang sama namun belum sempat menonton‚Ä¶ 
more', 'Trust me, this film is best experienced if you go in knowing nothing. Don‚Äôt read anything about the plot. Let it surprise you.', 'Ada 3 hal yang tidak bisa diubah: masa lalu, rasa sakit, dan kematian.
Konsep time loop yang dikemas sebenarnya standar, tapi di tangan Yandy Laurens berubah menjadi sangat ajaib. Seperti versi series, versi film justru berputar lebih luas dalam mengeksplorasi tentang waktu, usaha, sia-sia, masa lalu, dan cinta, yang sama sekali gak gua ekspektasikan bisa seindah itu ceritanya. Yang bikin gua gak habis pikir adalah bagaimana Yandy Laurens mengolah konsep time loop dalam 3 bab layaknya lukisan yang sangat cantik: visual, color grading, senja, quotes hidup, autentik, music scoring, pemandangan Kroasia, sampai keindahan fenomena langka seperti aurora hijau dan merah turut hadir dalam melengkapi suasana. Konsep waktunya terasa lebih matang dari versi series, dan setiap kesempatan kedua itu hilang, waktu‚Ä¶ 
more']

Title: The Old¬†Oak
Text:
A pub landlord in a previously thriving mining community struggles to hold onto his pub. Meanwhile, tensions rise in the town when Syrian refugees are placed in the empty houses in the¬†community.
['sometimes you just need to cry in the cinema surrounded by old people on a friday afternoon', 'Made me think about the refugees I have met throughout my life and the terrible ordeal they go through.\xa0
We went to see it together in the cinema, and gave us a sense of empowerment and hope in a kinder world.
Ken provokes people to think positively. That can be an unstoppable force.', 'The basic problem with Ken Loach is that his films avoid complexity. You don‚Äôt get working class people working through their internal contradictions in his films; at best you get basically virtuous people who are put upon by external circumstances, be that the Stalinists or the Black and Tans or the Home Office. These films can‚Äôt resonate with real, complicated people who aren‚Äôt already sympathetic to the narrative presented, so they don‚Äôt work as propaganda, but they‚Äôre too dedicated to being propaganda to stand on their own as plausible stories grounded in strong performances. It‚Äôs like he‚Äôs been chasing the high of 
Cathy Come Home 
being discussed in parliament\xa0his whole career. As much as I wish it weren‚Äôt so, social‚Ä¶

Title: The Lion in¬†Winter
Text:
Henry II and his estranged queen, Eleanor of Aquitaine, battle over the choice of an¬†heir.
['If you thought YOUR family Christmas gatherings were dysfunctional, just watch 
The Lion in Winter
, or read a sampling of my favorite quotes:
- "I'd hang you from the nipples, but you'd shock the children."
- "A king? Because you put your ass on purple cushions?"
- "Well, what shall we hang... the holly, or each other?"
- "Oh Eleanor, you've brought me my tombstone! You spoil me!"
- "I'm vilifying you for God's sake‚Äî pay attention!"
Peter O'Toole and Katharine Hepburn are a pairing made in heaven.', 'Nigel Terry as the dopey prince looks like a Monty Python character and I could never take him seriously
Also baby Timothy Dalton as a sneaky French king rules', "Switches from wit to venom faster than the flip of a coin. It's almost impressive to note how high the stakes feel, considering that they are vehemently personal, yet they resonate on an epic, virtually blockbuster-level scale. This unflinching yet spirited clash between two titans is unmatched by anything in today's cinematic standards. Yet, The Lion in Winter offers even more than the sum of its two main parts. It goes beyond a simple battle, transcending into what can only be described as the greatest domestic war of all time."]

Title: Taipei¬†Story
Text:

She hopes that her boyfriend Lung is the key to the future, but Lung is stuck in a past that combines baseball and traditional loyalty that leads him to squander his nest egg bailing her father out of financial¬†trouble.
['A monument to all the things left behind during the unforgiving process of forging an identity.', 'lonely people in neon cities is my favorite genre. a sobering reminder of how much we lose in the march for something better.', '"It cannot be said that Taipei is a modern and Western-style city, in the same way that one could affirm this of Shanghai, for example. Rather it is an example of some generally late-capitalist urbanization (which one hesitates, except to make the point, to call postmodern), of a now classic proliferation of the urban fabric that one finds everywhere in the First and Third Worlds alike." - Frederick Jameson, 
The Geopolitical Aesthetic
"How was Los Angeles?"
"It's just like Taipei." 
A very lazy viewer could point to the Western pursuits of the two main characters in 
Taipei Story
 and draw the conclusion that the film is a comment on American influence on the far east. Chin (Tsai Chin) has a‚Ä¶

Text:
Victor Frankenstein is a promising young doctor who, devastated by the death of his mother during childbirth, becomes obsessed with bringing the dead back to life. His experiments lead to the creation of a monster, which Frankenstein has put together with the remains of corpses. It‚Äôs not long before Frankenstein regrets his¬†actions.
['Every line is shouted, every shot the camera is spinning in circles around the actors. Ken, dude, you gotta chill out.', 'This movie is in a constant state of almost becoming a musical.', "Absolutely gorgeous, all the money they threw at another classic literary monster after BRAM STOKER'S DRACULA blew up is right there on the screen, but where Coppola pervily transmuted that text into a syphilitic sex panic nightmare, Branagh characteristically manages only to make a very literal adaptation here, reverently underlining every thematic note. Not that there's any real shame in that, you could do a hell of a lot worse."]

Title: The King of Staten¬†Island
Text:
Scott has been a case of arrested development ever since his firefighter father died when he was seven. He‚Äôs now reached his mid-20s having achieved little, chasing a dream of becoming a tattoo artist that seems far out of reach. As his ambitious younger sister heads off to college, Scott is still living with his exhausted ER nurse mother and spends his days smoking weed, hanging with the guys ‚Äî Oscar, Igor and Richie ‚Äî and secretly hooking up with his childhood friend Kelsey. But when his mother starts dating a loudmouth firefighter named Ray, it sets off a chain of events that will force Scott to grapple with his grief and take his first tentative steps toward moving forward in¬†life. √ó
['The same cinematographer shot\xa0
There Will Be Blood', 'Judd Apatow‚Äôs work bears any number of personal signatures, but it boils down to the two things he loves most of all: Overlong movies about overgrown man-children, and helping commercially unproven comedians become huge stars by making films and HBO shows in which they embody lightly fictionalized versions of themselves.
So while an 140-minute dramedy in which ‚ÄúSNL‚Äù breakout Pete Davidson essentially plays Dete Pavidson might sound like a risky gamble for a major studio to release at the height of the summer movie season (such as it is this year), Apatow would sooner cast Ivanka Trump as Paul Rudd‚Äôs next wife than miss out on the chance to work on a semi-autobiographical origin story with a tabloid-famous 25-year-old stoner‚Ä¶ 
more', 'so now i want to do coke with steve buscemi']

Title: Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo¬†Bay

Title: RoboCop¬†2
Text:
After a successful deployment of the RoboCop Law Enforcement unit, OCP sees its goal of urban pacification come closer and closer, but as this develops, a new narcotic known as ‚ÄúNuke‚Äù invades the streets led by God-delirious leader Cane. As this menace grows, it may prove to be too much for Murphy to handle. OCP tries to replicate the success of the first unit, but ends up with failed prototypes with suicidal issues‚Ä¶ until Dr. Faxx, a scientist straying away from OCP‚Äôs path, uses Cane as the new subject for the RoboCop 2 project, a living¬†God. √ó
['The future liberals want.', '"Jesus had days like this." 
"Make 'Made in America' mean something again."
Verhoeven's sharp satire of Reagan era economics, militarization of police and corporate privatization of public services/our bodies that doubled as an ultraviolent sleazy pulp commentary on American entertainment is in the hands of Kershner and Miller a shinier, goofier comic book version of it that still kinda works but does undercut much of its dirty, gruesome potency about state and corporate killing machines, and instead becomes the kind of entertainment Verhoeven was satirizing. 
But luckily for this film, as politically incoherent and downright absurd as it is, I kinda like this sort of gross bullshit when it is as vividly and cartoonishly realized as it is here, and‚Ä¶

Title: Zero¬†Day
Text:
Two troubled adolescents chronicle the events that ultimately lead up to a terrifying assault on their¬†school.
['his ass was not picking up the phone', '‚ÄúDude, I want you to know, like I couldn‚Äôt have done this with anyone else. Like, I don‚Äôt know what would‚Äôve happened to me if we hadn‚Äôt been friends.‚Äù
it feels like every school shooting movie is about two boys in love.\xa0
Elephant 
is a movie about two boys realizing their love for each other through the planning and enactment of spectacular violence, and 
Zero Day 
is a movie about two boys obfuscating their love for each other through the planning and enactment of spectacular violence.\xa0
this movie is a stunning investigation of the phenomena of the school shooting, exposing those events for what they are: senseless, fascistic acts of violence inspired by nothing more than the subtly unbearable conditions‚Ä¶

Title: Romance
Text:
Frustrated by the lack of intimacy in her relationship, a young schoolteacher goes through a series of intimidating and often violent sexual¬†partners.
['hope whoever the baby i just watched get live-birthed is doing well', 'Let it not be said that Breillat does not understand sexual submission. She crafts a scene about halfway through this film that manages to be both erotically charged and intensely disquieting as a man and a woman engage in a sadomasochistic exchange. The man is repugnant in his views, but in a way, that\'s somehow more appealing. He creates an atmosphere, a suspension of disbelief, such that her willingness to be with him sexually is moot. She is allowed to believe that his dominance is real, even though he asks directly, :"Do you want me to dominate you?" He gives her the agency to submit, and that is the appeal, that is the enticement. That\'s not what the film is‚Ä¶ \nmore', 'All the french know is sex, pubes, smoking cigs & being melancholic.']

Title: March of the¬†Penguins
Text:
Every year, thousands of Antarctica‚Äôs emperor penguins make an astonishing journey to breed their young. They walk, marching day and night in single file 70 miles into the darkest, driest and coldest continent on Earth. This amazing, true-life tale is touched with humour and alive with thrills. Breathtaking photography captures the transcendent beauty and staggering drama of devoted parent penguins who, in the fierce polar winter, take turns guarding their egg and trekking to the ocean in search of food. Predators hunt them, storms lash them. But the safety of their adorable chicks makes it all worthwhile. So follow the leader‚Ä¶ to¬†adventure!! √ó
['Walking all that way in the cold must be terribly tiring. A nice warm coat is always good for a journey.', 'doesn‚Äôt pass the bechdel test', "Do not, I repeat, do NOT watch this while hungry.
It'll only make you wonder what these little cute bastards will taste like.
Now I'm even hungrier.
Damnit.
Bloody penguins.
Walking around.
For 80 minutes.
They are cute though.
And possibly very tasty."]

Title: WarGames
Text:
High school student David Lightman has a talent for hacking. But while trying to hack into a computer system to play unreleased video games, he unwittingly taps into the Department of Defense‚Äôs war computer and initiates a confrontation of global proportions. Together with his friend and a wizardly computer genius, David must race against time to outwit his opponent and prevent a nuclear¬†Armageddon.
['A movie just about David‚Äôs weird parents who are totally oblivious to their son‚Äôs hacking, don‚Äôt care when he‚Äôs arrested by the FBI, and butter (uncooked!) corn by coating a piece of bread and then rubbing the bread on the cob, is the great 1980s spinoff we never got.', 'Ohhhhhh. \nSo this is what Ferris does when he‚Äôs not skipping school.', 'Now why was their first instinct to nuke Las Vegas']

more', 'Sono's most self-indulgent project, which means he's on full beast mode and we're driving 90mph down the opposite lane of a freeway in a gasoline tanker. Sono just took his hand away from the steering wheel and placed it on my shoulder, palm up, then asked if I felt "in charge", that's when I knew chances of me recovering from this trauma are slim. This is fifteen levels of fucked, and I feel like I should be desensitized to this sort of mania and depravity by now but news flash, I'm not, probably because the performances are so realistic you'd think the cast were held at gunpoint behind the camera, as usual I'm covered in sweat and had to pause‚Ä¶ 
more', 'After shooting 15 movies and two TV shows this decade alone, hyper-prolific renegade filmmaker Sono Sion was rushed to a Tokyo hospital in February, where emergency surgery was performed to save his life. The gonzo auteur behind the gleefully demented likes of ‚ÄúSuicide Circle‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhy Don‚Äôt You Play in Hell?‚Äù had just finished work on an unhinged Amazon Prime series called ‚ÄúTokyo Vampire Hotel,‚Äù which may have been his wildest project thus far; high praise for someone whose previous career highlights include the likes of ‚ÄúLove Exposure‚Äù (a four-hour epic about a teenage Catholic who falls in with a secret cult of up-skirt panty photographers) and ‚ÄúTokyo Tribe‚Äù (a hyper-violent rap opera about a gangster who torches an entire‚Ä¶ 
more', 'a kinda film that makes u go "what the fuck" for its entire runtime', 'When I chose this film, Netflix automatically started playing the English dubbed version. It's so annoying. After I double checked to make sure this wasn't Sion Sono's English language debut, I changed the language settings to Japanese audio with English subtitles.
It's about filmmakers who push the limits to get discovered intertwined with a story about girls who were best friends in high school. On board with the filmmakers at first, I soon became more interested in the girls' story. It's a pretty crazy ride filled with action, reversals, and more. Sion Sono is a solid filmmaker and he doesn't disappoint. 
Vegan alert:
Killing a guy then boiling and stewing him, then taking the "soft meat" and innards and liquefying them in a blender', '‚ÄúDo you know what it feels like to kill someone?‚Äù
A loosely based take on real life events of a serial killer in 1990‚Äôs Japan‚Äîand lesbian Romeo and Juliet.
Sono‚Äôs depiction of a narcissistic psychopath is deeply disturbing and often maddening, with vile methods of physical torture and mental manipulation, but works wonders in 
The Forest of Love
. A young group of wannabe filmmakers are convinced conman Joe Murata is a serial killer, they decide to film his biopic but find themselves trapped under his charming egotistical ways‚Äî we follow the sadistic conman that continually gets his way while playing and preying on whomever will fall under his ‚Äúcharming‚Äù spell.\xa0
‚Äú
I work really hard to turn my lies into reality.‚Äù
‚Ä¶

Sheer bleakness, pure depravity. Lars Von Trier is jealous and happy at the same time.
Maybe it's simply because the editing and everything feels very tight, but the film version is much better than the extended version, even if a lot of what I learned in that version helped me appreciate certain situations at lots of times, such as in the bank scene. Also, while I understand why there is a scene of these people being savagely slain in the forest, after watching this version, I feel it wasn't necessary, and the back and forth transition between‚Ä¶ 
more", "Hated the treatment / use of female characters in this film. It was like watching a weird old man's fantasies for what felt like a whole day. It was sooo long and dragged out.
I have not seen much of his work, but it was obvious to me that he was inspired by himself. As narcissistic as the main focus of the film.
Maybe that's also why he had so many uninteresting references to Romeo & Juliet.
With that said, I am confident any fans of his, who know his filmography, will love the probable multiple shout outs he gives to himself. I only noticed ones from two of his films, but I am sure there are many more. I think,‚Ä¶ 
more", "It's my first time seeing a Sion Sono film and honestly, I don't know what to feel. 
It's mad, perverted, disturbing, and just plain sick... yet I can't seem to take my eyes off the screen and still found myself captivated and intrigued on what's going on. But I don't know, the plot seems messy and convoluted and the characters were all unlikeable as hell. I can't believe I sat through this.", '‚ÄúDid you love me, even just a tiny bit?‚Äù
An intensely sickening crime movie about an indie filmmaking crew trying to capture the life of an eccentric con man; Sion Sono‚Äôs 151 minute feature length cut of 
The Forest of Love 
is a sporadic and extreme jumble of trauma, abuse, and major gore as its protracted plot messily unravels in this apparent condensation of the prolific filmmaker‚Äôs most indulgent tropes. However, it never fails to entertain; at times going too far or feeling too unfocused, but constantly building in severity and throwing new spanners into the works of its already shocking story. I can only imagine what else is added to the extended 248 miniseries cut, which I may get around to when I‚Äôm more familiar with Sono‚Äôs filmography, but as far as the movie goes I cant deny enjoying it.', "A 150 minute multi-wave orgasm over the moment where Juliet discovers a dead Romeo. 
The Forest of Love
 is one of Sion Sono's best films, even though it is partially just him going through the motions. This is 
Love Exposure
 meets 
Suicide Club
 meets 
Why Don't You Play in Hell?
. There's also shades of 
Noriko's Dinner Table
 and 
Strange Circus
. Sion Sono explores his usual intersection of love, sex, and art, whilst maintaining his penchant for schoolgirls and lesbianism.
Sono always plays on the boundary between fetishistic misogyny and a comment upon that topic. Here he is clearly making a statement. 
The Forest of Love
 is a satire on influence and social control. Women are humiliated, made to want to‚Ä¶ 
more", 'All-Time Favourites
What makes ‚ÄòThe Forest of Love‚Äô great is not the maniacal, disturbing, electrifying atmosphere that only Sion Sono can create, it is because of the moments where the chaos halts, where the audience can see the pandemonium briefly turn into beautiful tranquility, allowing them to appreciate the tender tale being told amongst the bedlam.']

Title: Apocalypse¬†Now
Text:
At the height of the Vietnam war, Captain Benjamin Willard is sent on a dangerous mission that, officially, ‚Äúdoes not exist, nor will it ever exist.‚Äù His goal is to locate - and eliminate - a mysterious Green Beret Colonel named Walter Kurtz, who has been leading his personal army on illegal guerrilla missions into enemy¬†territory.
['I love the smell of marlon brando inventing acting through three seconds of screen time and literally obliterating every other actor ever in the morning. also, napalm', 'wow sofia coppola‚Äôs dad is actually pretty good at the whole making movies thing i guess he takes after his daughter <3', "The rain patters deliberately. It's trying. It's trying real hard to cool off the world, but to no avail. The endless sweat parading down the faces of the losing minds and the tired souls only enhances the fever dreams and the sights of the figures within the shadows. The greatest cinematographic achievement of all time."]

Title: Paycheck
Text:
Michael Jennings is a genius who‚Äôs hired ‚Äì and paid handsomely ‚Äì by high-tech firms to work on highly sensitive projects, after which his short-term memory is erased so he‚Äôs incapable of breaching security. But at the end of a three-year job, he‚Äôs told he isn‚Äôt getting a paycheck and instead receives a mysterious envelope. In it are clues he must piece together to find out why he wasn‚Äôt paid ‚Äì and why he‚Äôs now in hot¬†water.
["This one's finally starting to click for me a little. Woo's oft-stated love of Hitchcock manifests here with a literal bag full of setups to pay off. It's basically an excuse to move from one puzzle scenario to the next, at its best sort of a feature-length version of the mall chase in MINORITY REPORT. My main issue with it still stands, though: it looks cheap, like it was shot in a convention center in Vancouver or something, and I still think the editing is frequently arrhythmic by Woo's standards, cut for narrative clarity rather than visceral impact. But it's packed with trademark grace notes like a bead of sweat bouncing off a bullet in slow motion, or those patented spontaneous releases of kinetic energy like a guy getting launched into the air by an errant shotgun blast.", 'No\xa0
Minority Report
 or 
Total Recall
 but fun to see Woo flex a bit with his own variation on Hitchcock identity thriller chase/suspense sequences. Lots of stylish inserts of information during the action as Ben and the film both catch up with the forgotten memories/logistics of escape simultaneously. Was happy to see him get that slomo dove + bullet + explosion in there at the last minute too. Paul Giamatti shows up for a bit. Good movie.', 'This was remarkably restrained for a John Woo movie and by that I mean there was only one dove.
I would rate this as both an underrated Woo and an underrated Philip K Dick adaptation.
Paul Giamatti is in it.']

Title: One Child¬†Nation
Text:
Through interviews with both victims and instigators, Nanfu Wang, a first-time mother, breaks open decades of silence on a vast, unprecedented social experiment that shaped ‚Äî and destroyed ‚Äî countless lives in¬†China.
['China instituted its one child rule in 1979. I was born after that, so I had never known anything different. The documentary by Nanfu Wang and Jialing Zhang covers just what happened because of the burden on couples to limit their family to just one child. The truth is worse than anyone previously imagined: there were forced sterilizations and abortions, sketchy adoptions, child abandonment, and the overall infringement on women's rights. The documentary is thorough; it's tough realizing just how crazily China's "one child" rule impacted so many people.
Note:
Extremely violent situations to children are discussed, including maggots on bodies of dead children.
Vegan alert:
Children's coats are fur-lined.', "A great example of personal filmmaking that takes on international scale. Just devastating. I'm gonna need cartoons about talking animals for a few days, please.", 'This was so good because it showed all the factual information about what the one child nation policy was really like for people while also being a deeply personal story for the filmmakers.\xa0
So many moments in this were devastating to learn about. It was important to show the topic of control and having your choices taken from you by your government. Nanfu Wang made a really powerful documentary.']

Title: Death¬†Wish
Text:
After his wife is murdered by street punks, a pacifistic New York City architect becomes a one-man vigilante squad, prowling the streets for would-be muggers after¬†dark.
['This is how everyone that jerks off to the second amendment thinks they‚Äôre going to be', 'How did this movie launch a franchise??
Charles Bronson is occasionally fun on screen but doesn‚Äôt do well with emotional scenes. I have liked him in supporting roles so I was hoping he could do more to anchor a movie, but let me down in this case.
I found the directing quite good, the whole movie felt gritty and scary. I was impressed by the tone this movie strikes, and the scary neighborhood it created.\xa0
The politics of this movie were very distasteful in my opinion. I try to give a star rating based on the quality of the film and not my moral objections, but it was hard to separate in this case. He is shooting to kill anyone‚Ä¶ 
more', 'Gloom filled 70‚Äôs vigilante grime classic from Michael\xa0Winner‚Äîwho turns wintertime nyc into a urban vengeance three quarter coat western loaded with great camera work, sleazy urchin infested streets,\xa0questionable politics, a weirdo score that I really dig, and Charles Bronson adding to his monolithic status as conscientious objector Paul Kersey‚Äîthe architect of death.
Love this sicko movie with its dirty bleak 70‚Äôs vibes as well as Winner‚Äôs tight (and undervalued) direction, and Bronson‚Äôs 20 year dedication to the role of judge, jury, and executioner in a franchise that gets wilder with each entry.
The third movie might be my favorite, but this is essential 70‚Äôs bullshit and that final shot is incredible.']

Title: Frankenweenie
Text:
When young Victor‚Äôs pet dog Sparky (who stars in Victor‚Äôs home-made monster movies) is hit by a car, Victor decides to bring him back to life the only way he knows how.
